content.description:
Dic mihi quae fuerit cautaecautus, -a, -um, adj. = diligens, -entis sollertiasollertia, -ae, f. = ars, artis gentis,
quis labor, et vires, quae dotesdos, -otis, f. = ingenium, -i, rarararus, -a, -um, adj.: rareque membra.
content.question: In line 1, the subjunctive fuerit is translated

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
